question: https://www.quora.com/What-are-the-top-5-benefits-of-having-a-website-for-your-business

Answer: A website means a compilation of related web pages that are listed under a single domain name. In simpler words, It is basically a preamble of your business on the internet that can let visitors know what your company is all about and what products/ services it offers. In recent times, the benefits of having a website have increased exponentially and here we will discuss 5 of the many reasons why having an official website can help your business grow1. Cost EffectiveCompany websites can be very helpful in cutting operating costs like rent, compensation of employed staff, and cost of other miscA website means a compilation of related web pages that are listed under a single domain name. In simpler words, It is basically a preamble of your business on the internet that can let visitors know what your company is all about and what products/ services it offers. In recent times, the benefits of having a website have increased exponentially and here we will discuss 5 of the many reasons why having an official website can help your business grow1. Cost EffectiveCompany websites can be very helpful in cutting operating costs like rent, compensation of employed staff, and cost of other miscellaneous amenities. If you have a website, you can sell/offer your goods and services directly through it and gain an edge over your competitors.2. Enhances ReliabilityHaving an official company website makes you seem more reliable and increases your credibility as most reputable companies today have their own websites. If you have an impressive website, viewers are tempted to give you a chance because it is easier for them to have trust in your capabilities and it also accentuates your commitment to your business.3. Information ExchangeA website enables you to have smooth communication with your prospective clients as most of the important information is already listed on the website and they just have to reach out to you on it to seal the deal. Not only this, but receiving reviews and feedback from clients can also be made much simpler by having an official website.4. 24x7 AccessibilityYour website is accessible to people day and night, 24x7 and 365 days a year. Anyone can visit it and make a purchase/ sale offer anytime they want which makes it very beneficial as it is harder for you to be available to customers 24x7 but having a website makes it possible for you to do this.5. ConvenientPeople can visit countless websites in a day but they can’t visit too many offline stores in a day. This is due to the sheer convenience of having a website since they can make sales/ purchases even while sitting in the comfort of their homes. Not only is it convenient for your clients but also for you as you are able to allot sufficient time to each of their needs/likes and also it creates a more organized system of doing business.

Additionally, given that the majority of businesses today have websites, it's possible that by remaining offline, you could be losing business to your rivals. Additionally, given that the majority of businesses today have websites, it's possible that by remaining offline, you could be losing business to your rivals. Answer: Bill Gates said:Here are the benefits, in addition to access to a huge solvent audience, your own website brings to your business:1. Availability of informationIf a user is interested in your company, the first thing they will do is try to find your site. If it is not there, you are not in the trend, the digitalization of the business has not touched you yet, there is a minimum of information about you. There is no information - there is no trust, and the person goes to competitors.Continue ReadingBill Gates said:Here are the benefits, in addition to access to a huge solvent audience, your own website brings to your business:1. Availability of informationIf a user is interested in your company, the first thing they will do is try to find your site. If it is not there, you are not in the trend, the digitalization of the business has not touched you yet, there is a minimum of information about you. There is no information - there is no trust, and the person goes to competitors.2. Business cardA website is a digital business card for your company. Here you can find the address, location of branches, opening hours; view products or services, see the team, read reviews and feature articles about your product.3. SalesIf the site has the opportunity to immediately order a product or service, and pay for it online, it becomes a real seller.4. Feedback from buyersThe “Ask a question” form on the site, chat bots or chats with a live manager - do you think this is only for visitors? No, it is much more important for the management of the company. Feedback will show the shortcomings of a product or service - when you know about the problem, you can quickly fix it. And that means ultimately increasing profits.5. Information about the audienceIf you set some kind of metric on the site, you can learn a lot of interesting things about your audience.

question: https://www.quora.com/What-are-the-top-5-benefits-of-having-a-website-for-your-business

Answer: Hi there!I have to say I’m kind of astonished seeing so many people say that websites aren’t that necessary. If website users are looking for a product or service, where do they go? To a website of a company that has the product they need. When do they go if they have questions and want to learn more about your product? To a website. And where people can sign up for a newsletter or buy your product? Also on the website. Your website is one of the most important channels for generating new customers there is!The second thing most businesses should have is a social media account. As there are arHi there!I have to say I’m kind of astonished seeing so many people say that websites aren’t that necessary. If website users are looking for a product or service, where do they go? To a website of a company that has the product they need. When do they go if they have questions and want to learn more about your product? To a website. And where people can sign up for a newsletter or buy your product? Also on the website. Your website is one of the most important channels for generating new customers there is!The second thing most businesses should have is a social media account. As there are around 3.5 billion social media users right now, social media are an incredible place to find new customers for your business and keep your current customers interested in your products and your brand. It’s a great place to promote your latest products or service but also to build your reputation as an expert in a given topic. Plus, what other channel can give you a chance to interact with your customers directly? Through social media, you can ask for their ideas, thoughts, or comments and also use social media for customer support, and this way, build a relationship with them.And in case you wanted to say, “I don’t think I have enough time for social media as a small business owner,” don’t worry - there’s no need for you to sit and post every day, not when you can use social media management and scheduling tool such asHave a nice day!

question: https://www.quora.com/What-are-the-top-5-benefits-of-having-a-website-for-your-business

Answer: Most existing businesses have a website. Being a web developer isn't just about finding a site to build from scratch, in fact 60% of the time it's just overhauling or replacing the website they already have.Just search for local businesses websites. If they suck, contact them and tell them how you can make their website better and therefore improve their business. This is part of my business model and I have a 50% closing rate, meaning half the businesses I ask, agree to let me do it.New businesses will come to you by word of mouth if you do well for these existing businesses.

More people aren’t scared to explore new currencies and payment methods removing them from the stigma of these big corporations that just simply monopolizes and just limiNot just in 2020. but in many more years to come. Blockchain or crypto has made a huge impact in today’s society and I’m more fascinated to learn how it will evolve and co-exist with our existing processes and technology.As we all know, cryptocurrencies are getting a lot attention right now since it already surpassed their current status last year more and more people believed that this can be accepted in our current society. More people aren’t scared to explore new currencies and payment methods removing them from the stigma of these big corporations that just simply monopolizes and just limiting our options.One project which I think have made an impact as I was checking for alternatives when it comes to payment was NavCoin. I’m amazed how independent this platform imagine an open-source, blockchain based Proof of Stake cryptocurrency. Its design is public, nobody owns or controls it, and everyone can take part. The platform run by its users, for users like us - with an incentivised network of nodes verifying payments all around the world.Just a quickie history about it NavCoin, it is a community-run network that was started in 2014. It initially used Proof of Work, but quickly made the shift to Proof of Stake. With no ICO or premine, NavCoin has always been self-funded to ensure a fair distribution and that everyone has a chance to get involved.In short this platform are just one of the platforms that clearly provides solutions that many of us have been trying to resolved. We want cheap, fast and performance-driven tools and not just because we don’t have any other options.Imagine if there are more blockchain platforms that resolves such issues, I doubt people will forget it. Clearly blockchain will not be a trend but it will definitely be passed down as a marvelous discovery in today’s technology.

Answer: I can only speak for myself. I have three masters degrees and am working on a fourth. It is a bit crazy, but I love being in school. My first masters degree was more general than I would have liked. I had the opportunity to get a full scholarship for a second masters degree (which is rare) so I went for it. Then I had the opportunity to go to Harvard for a third masters, one that was particularly useful and applicable, so I took that opportunity. Now I have the opportunity to get a free MBA through a fellowship, one that will fill in a lot of missing experience/knowledge in my field. So, I amI can only speak for myself. I have three masters degrees and am working on a fourth. It is a bit crazy, but I love being in school. My first masters degree was more general than I would have liked. I had the opportunity to get a full scholarship for a second masters degree (which is rare) so I went for it. Then I had the opportunity to go to Harvard for a third masters, one that was particularly useful and applicable, so I took that opportunity. Now I have the opportunity to get a free MBA through a fellowship, one that will fill in a lot of missing experience/knowledge in my field. So, I am taking that opportunity again. It IS hard. It is a bit of overkill. However, they have all helped me in many ways. I do also want to get a PhD at some point in the next 5 years. I didn’t plan on having so many degrees, but it worked out well. I also have two bachelors degrees in related fields.
